smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams were found in the provided file.
All use cases in the diagrams (Pages 2 and 3) are associated with actors, either directly or through <<include>> relationships to use cases that have actors.
No distinct use cases with synonymous names describing the same activity were found associated with the same actor.
No duplicate model element names were found within the same package.

No obvious redundant data copying (denormalization) without foreign keys was detected. Common column names like 'nimetus' appear to represent specific attributes for their respective entities rather than redundant copies.
Use case naming is consistent; all use cases start with an active verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Registreeri').
In the State Diagram (Page 8), all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, Unustatud, Lõpetatud) are reachable via transitions.
In the Activity Diagram (Page 4), all actions and decisions are reachable via the control flow.

On the 'Autode register (Klassifikaator)' diagram (Page 11), the association between the 'Auto' class and the 'Auto_kütuse_liik' class lacks a multiplicity indicator on the 'Auto' end of the relationship line.
The Class Diagram 'Klassifikaatorite register' (Page 7) contains 11 central class elements (excluding the package boundary), which exceeds the threshold of 10.
On the 'Klassifikaatorite register' diagram (Page 7), the class 'Klassifikaator' has 10 generalization relationships (visual connection lines) connecting to it from various subclasses.
The layout of elements across the diagrams appears relatively uniform, with no instances of related elements being placed excessively far apart compared to the average distance.
All use cases and activity diagram actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali').
No class, table, attribute, or use case names were found with 3 or fewer characters (Shortest found were 'Isik', 'Riik', 'Auto' which are 4 characters).
All class names start with an uppercase letter and use singular nouns (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Klient').
All attribute/column names start with a lowercase letter (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'reg_aeg', 'nimetus').
All database table names use singular nouns (e.g., 'Isik', 'Kasutajakonto', 'Tootaja_roll').

No class, table, or attribute names were found using Hungarian notation or type prefixes (e.g., 'tbl_', 'str'). Prefixes like 'PK_' and 'FK_' found in the database diagrams are explicitly allowed exceptions.
